node.title: Feat Containerize the application to improve cross OS compatibility
node.body:
🚀 **PR Summary:**
Adds a Dockerfile to support containerization as part of https://github.com/OthersideAI/self-operating-computer/issues/36.

🛠️ **Changes Made:**
- Included Dockerfile for containerization.
- Used Python:3.11-slim as the base image (Considering it's lightweight and supports all libs).

🔍 **Testing:**
- Tested successful build and execution using the Dockerfile.

👩‍💻 **Next Steps:**
- Review and merge if no issues arise.

🔧 **How to Build and Run:**
1. **Build the Docker Image:**
   ```bash
   
   docker build -t your_image_name .

2. **Run the Docker Image:**
   ```bash
   
   docker run -it your_image_name

node.title: [backend] Add access level and password to Room model
node.body:
まずはbackendでprivate/protected/publicなどのアクセスレベルに関するロジックを実装していきます。

## モデルについて少し考えてまとめたもの
https://usatie.notion.site/Public-Private-Protected-channel-5b21d8a3dc2348f09b0d1c5d9d3176ba?pvs=4

## 実装したもの
RoomとUserOnRoomに関する以下それぞれのエンドポイントを、テストと一緒に実装した。
- `PATCH /room/:id/:userId` (Update Role)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId/kick/:userId` (Kick User)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId/leave` (Leave Room)
- `DELETE /room/:roomId` (Delete Room)
- `PATCH /room/:roomId` (Update Room)
- `GET /room` (Get Rooms)
- `POST /room/:roomId/invite/:userId` (Invite User)
- `POST /room/:id` (Enter Room)
- `GET /room/:id` (Get Room)
- `POST /rooms` (Create Room)

## 迷ったポイント
### 高階関数とRef<T>による共通化を少しやりすぎている気がする
  - そのせいで読みにくかったりメンテしづらかったりしそうという
  - 同じコードを何度も書くことに耐えきれず多少無茶して共通化している
### 入室・招待と退室・キックのAPIについてはREST的に考えれば統一的に扱うこともできるのですが、エンドポイントを分割している
分割した方が認証と認可のロジックを非常にシンプルに保つことができる。最初は分割せずに書いてたのですが、テストも実装も結構大変で。。。一応GPTに相談してた時のログはこちら
https://chat.openai.com/share/176a2982-bf5e-4bbe-8d06-74e4c96a5ba5

#### 分割しない場合
入室・招待（POST /room/:roomId/:userId）
退室・キック（DELETE /room/:roomId/:userId）

#### 分割する場合
入室（POST /room/:roomId/）
招待（POST /room/:roomId/invite/:userId）
退室（DELETE /room/:roomId/leave）
キック（DELETE /room/:roomId/kick/:userId）

## 今後のTODO案
1. Ownerが退室する場合の処理（Owner以外で最初に入室したAdminがownerになる、いなければMember、誰もいなければRoom削除）
2. ownershipのtransferに関するendpoint作る
3. 1つのRoomに1人のOwnerしか存在できないように、Room.ownerIdを持たせる
4. passwordを直接保存するのではなく、hashを保存する

## 実装予定
以下のような順番で実装していく予定。

1. Prismaのschemaを変更 :white_check_mark:
5. 既存のビルド、Unitテスト、E2Eテストが通るように修正 :white_check_mark:
6. Privateに関するテストとロジックを実装（GET/GET/POST/PATCH） :white_check_mark:
7. Protectedに関するテストとロジックを実装（GET/GET/POST/PATCH） :white_check_mark:

node.bodyText: The error handling for findUniqueOrThrow is specific and correctly rethrows unexpected errors. However, the error code 'P2025' is Prisma-specific and should be documented or abstracted for maintainability.
Modifying the request object directly to add admin is not a best practice as it can lead to unexpected side effects. It would be better to use a more formal method of passing data.
There should be a check to ensure that the room exists after attempting to find it with findRoom. If the room does not exist, an appropriate exception should be thrown.
That error is handled globally

commit分かれててめちゃめちゃ見やすいです。分かれてなかったら、絶対レビューしないですww
別のコメントでもしたのですが、PRを分割にする方に向かうのもアリかと思いました。
自動生成のコードはむしろコミット分けてもよいかもです！これ記事に書かなかったんですけど、別にコミット感で必ずしもテストが通る必要は無いっていうのは言ってました。
migration fileまとめちゃったほうが良い？
分からないですが、access level追加する変更とRoomEntity使う変更はcommit分けても良いのかと思ったり (fdc02b3 )
これはcommit名とは全く違う変更かと思ったり ( 0cd08c2 )

[backend] Implement POST /rooms endpoint
- Fix create room dto validation

これ、コミットメッセージだと思うんですけど、
このPR > Implement POST /rooms endpoint > Fix create room dto validation
って感じに3つのコンテキストがあるような気がしたりします（これはContextの分割レベルの話なので間違ってるって訳では無いのですが）
自分だったら、とりあえずPR1つでやることをもっと減らします。例えば、テストのリファクタとaccess levelの追加とか。
それで、Implement POST /rooms endpointか Add access level in roomみたいなタイトルのPRに対して、Fix create room dto validation がコミットメッセージになって、body消す感じですかね。
これは、http statusみたいな感じなんですか？うーん、これだけだとなんだか分からないです😅
このロジックは、guardにあるべきではなく、serviceにあるべきかと思ったり。schemaの確認はいろいろなところで使いたくなる気がします。
自分の入ってるprivateなroomは返さない感じですかね？
これ他の場所でドキュメント貼られてるの見ました！
最終的にmodelがfixしたら後でSquashしてまとめる予定！
なるほど！

おっしゃる通りw
最初は面倒だったので一緒に色々やってしまっていました

これ結構難しくて、最初からやることが直線的に見えてればそうなるのですが、開発しているうちにこの形式だと無理だな〜とかテスト追加してるうちに見えてきてDTOを変更したりとか、エンドポイントの設計を変えたり試行錯誤しながらのログになってるのですよね〜。
でも確かに最終的にPRを分割する気力があれば、そうするかも。（気力が足りれば・・・w）

そうなんすよ〜。
Prisma側で用意して欲しいですよねw
そういう要望もあるんだけど、用意されてなくてw
prisma/prisma#10394

すみません、このロジックやschemaの確認というのは具体的にどこの範囲のことを言ってますか・・・？
parameterが数字であることのバリデーションとかだとすると、僕もそうしたいんですが（通常はParseIntPipeとかでやるのですが）、どうやらPipeの前にGuardが呼ばれてしまうようなので不要なErrorを避けるためにこのロジックを持つ必要があるような気がしており。。。
（公式ドキュメントでは無いのですがRequestの処理される順番について）
https://ru-nestjs-docs.netlify.app/faq/request-lifecycle

In general, the request lifecycle looks like the following:

Incoming request
Globally bound middleware
Module bound middleware
Global guards
Controller guards
Route guards
Global interceptors (pre-controller)
Controller interceptors (pre-controller)
Route interceptors (pre-controller)
Global pipes
Controller pipes
Route pipes
Route parameter pipes
Controller (method handler)
Service (if exists)
Route interceptor (post-request)
Controller interceptor (post-request)
Global interceptor (post-request)
Exception filters (route, then controller, then global)
Server response

Introduced a Ref class for holding mutable references. Ensure that the usage of mutable references is necessary and that there's no simpler alternative that could be used, such as directly assigning the values to variables within the scope they are used.

Adding a NOT NULL column without a default value to an existing table will fail if the table is not empty. Consider adding a default value or a migration strategy for existing rows.
- ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL,
+ ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL DEFAULT 'PUBLIC',
Or, if the intention is to selectively set the value for existing rows, a separate migration step should be included to handle this before setting the column to NOT NULL.




Committable suggestion

❗ IMPORTANT
Carefully review the code before committing. Ensure that it accurately replaces the highlighted code, contains no missing lines, and has no issues with indentation.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN     "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL,
          
          
            
            ALTER TABLE "Room" ADD COLUMN "accessLevel" "AccessLevel" NOT NULL DEFAULT 'PUBLIC',
The addition of the password column is correct. However, ensure that the application handles this data securely, encrypting the password before storing it in the database.
なるほどです！
こっち側で条件分岐があるなら、describeを分けちゃっても良い気がしたり

ちょっとここは通話で話したいかもですね・・・！
特にロジックの話の部分は文面だけ読んでいてもよく僕が理解できていない部分がありそうです。ごめんなさい！
一応

controllerでするべきじゃない

に関していうと、Guardはcontrollerのhandlerとは別の場所ですが、もっと後で行うべきという意味ですかね。
（代案にCustom Validatorも含まれていたので混乱しているところがあります。Serviceですべき、という話だけなら理解できるのですが・・・！）
6. Route guards <- @UpdateRoomGuardはここで行われているはず
10. Global pipes <- @IsNotEmptyなどのvalidationはここで行われているはず
14. Controller (method handler) <- Controllerのmethod handler本体
15. Service (if exists)

今度電話しましょう！一応返信しておきます

Guardはcontrollerのhandlerとは別の場所ですが、もっと後で行うべきという意味ですかね。

確かにcontorllerではないですね。失礼。
もっと後で行うべきというよりかは、guardにあるべきでは無いかなって感じでした。
guardにあるべきではないと思う理由は

データの整合性を保つためのロジックが色々な場所に散らばる
再利用性が悪い（別のAPIで、そのAPIのメインの処理とは別にroomのupdateをしたい時に、guardは使えない？）

Interface (web) is responsible for decoding the input, convert values to proper types, then invoke a business (core) function, and finally render the result in the expected format (html, json, ...)

+authentication/authorizaton

通話で話したこと

web interface (Controller)は入出力のvalidationだけをすべき
DBへのアクセスが含まれているようなvalidationロジックはservice側で実行した方がいい
現状、UpdateRoomGuardなどは再利用は考えていないので、再利用に関しては考慮しない
Ensure that the canActivate method properly handles the case where user or params might be undefined to prevent runtime errors.

node.title: Packets goes _between_ server and client
node.body:
<!-- 🙌 Thanks for contributing to MDN Web Docs. Adding details below will help us to merge your PR faster. -->
### Summary
The statement I propose to be removed on line 69 i.e "sent from server to client" indicates that packets are only sent to the client. Yet, servers also receive packets from clients.

<!-- ✍️ Summarize your changes in one or two sentences -->
### Changes
So I changed some content of line 69 from "sent from server to client" to "transfered between the client and server"

### Motivation
I thought it is important to clarify this because we have a reasonable number of  beginners using MDN.

<!-- ❓ Why are you making these changes and how do they help readers? -->

### Additional details
You can get more context here: https://chat.openai.com/share/e875af6c-d468-4174-9740-0f869e229047

<!-- 🔗 Link to release notes, vendor docs, bug trackers, source control, or other places providing more context -->

node.bodyText:
Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Earlier we used the term "packets" to describe the format in which the data is transfered between the client and server. What do we mean here? Basically, when data is sent across the web, it is sent in thousands of small chunks. There are multiple reasons why data is sent in small packets. They are sometimes dropped or corrupted, and it's easier to replace small chunks when this happens. Additionally, the packets can be routed along different paths, making the exchange faster and allowing many different users to download the same website at the same time. If each website was sent as a single big chunk, only one user could download it at a time, which obviously would make the web very inefficient and not much fun to use.
          
          
            
            Earlier we used the term "packets" to describe the format in which the data is transferred between the client and server. What do we mean here? Basically, when data is sent across the web, it is sent in thousands of small chunks. There are multiple reasons why data is sent in small packets. They are sometimes dropped or corrupted, and it's easier to replace small chunks when this happens. Additionally, the packets can be routed along different paths, making the exchange faster and allowing many different users to download the same website at the same time. If each website was sent as a single big chunk, only one user could download it at a time, which obviously would make the web very inefficient and not much fun to use.
That's very nitpicky since the previous section specifically talks about server to client, but this certainly doesn't do any harm. Thank you!

Actually, to be in line with the rest of the lib, this should be getData (as we parse the metadata to find the data of a given id)
Why "hook"? This should now be usage agnostic (that's why I removed the delegate references in the non-language touched-up PR), no issue for this lib to be used in whatever metadata
meh, thought I removed the ref to delegates, as it can be used wherever (cf lib natspecs which should be correct then, including little ascii art and stuff)

see https://github.com/Bananapus/juice-contracts-v4/pull/37/files#diff-4cefaec2ffaef06618565b1b0a4e1472dfd6937ea0a3471c4ea318b978bfe510L5
can be copy-pasted, as this contract is just to test the lib anyway
used is an odd verb here, this is the minimum number of tokens the user should receive. Maybe something like  _minTokensReceived or _minTokenAmount
Adding both of these. Thank you @xBA5ED
Changed to minTokensPaidOut. Thank you!
Should this be renamed? Appears it's not the total supply.
BURN_PAUSED_AND_SENDER_NOT_VALID_TERMINAL_HOOK() unused, coming later?
NOT_CURRENT_CONTROLLER(); unused
@ who's discretion? Is it worth being more specific here i.e. "allowAdminMinting()"?
Just wanted to point out how great this is- It gives so much more context.
"deployJBERC20For"?
nope, remove. we removed the pauseBurn metadata flag. good call
meh. as far as JBTokens is concerned it is the total supply. just needs to add the pending reserved.
nice
nice
nice
Going with allowOwnerMinting. Nice
Yes
Keeping totalSupplyOf for now. But I think this is fair and worth revisiting if we can think of something really clear.

node.title: feat: add sessionStore singleton class
node.body: Add singleton class `Storage` mainly for prefix and suffix encapsulation and provide a clean api.

node.bodyText:
Occupying the concept of "storage" here sounds overkill, I would suggest some naming change 🤔
Also this seems to break the Node compatibility test.

Thanks, some improvements can be done.

  Pre-commit hooks should be applied here also : https://pre-commit.com/hooks.html

Module name should be more explicit (if someday we want to publish it an pypi) for instance tock-llm-indexing-tools, would be more aligned with the existing tock-py : https://github.com/theopenconversationkit/tock-py/blob/master/setup.py#L26

also ignore embeddings.json files to prevent some developper from commiting their API keys
 prefer putting  specific  .gitignore files in the package folder, in llm/orchestrator-server/
Remove this file it should be named __init__.py if you really want an init file
Can you update it to langchain 0.1.0
You should only use the abstraction layer BaseEMSetting not OpenAIEMSetting nor AzureOpenAIEMSetting
This is already handled by get_em_factory, simply load the configuration as a BaseEMSetting format.
Use a logger.info here

When formatting logs you should not use f-strings, because arguments are always evaluated before calling the logger, this means that the string rendering occurs even if we are in INFO mode and not DEBUG. Let the logger do the formatting (we call it lazy logging) for you using arguments and this format :
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                logging.debug(f"Beginning indexation session {session_uuid} at '{formatted_datetime}'")
          
          
            
                logging.debug("Beginning indexation session %s at '%s'", session_uuid, formatted_datetime)
          
      
    
    
  

Good reference about it : https://medium.com/flowe-ita/logging-should-be-lazy-bc6ac9816906

You could put this while in a function called tag_chunks, also this kind of data processing could be easily done using pandas in a more efficient way  like this :
import pandas as pd

# Example data: list of dictionaries
data = [
    {"doc_uuid": "A", "other_key": "value1"},
    {"doc_uuid": "B", "other_key": "value2"},
    {"doc_uuid": "A", "other_key": "value3"},
    {"doc_uuid": "B", "other_key": "value4"},
    {"doc_uuid": "C", "other_key": "value5"},
    # Add more dictionaries as needed
]

# Create DataFrame
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Group by 'doc_uuid' and generate incremental index
df['chunk'] = df.groupby('doc_uuid').cumcount()

# Convert the DataFrame to a list of dictionaries
flattened_data = df.to_dict('records')

flattened_data
This this chatgpt : https://chat.openai.com/share/639aade3-aaca-47ba-9c29-09638e0d428e

You are loading 2 times the configuration file, if you parse it using the TypeAdapter if the provider is unknown it will automatically through an exception.
You should parse it in the main them passe an EMSetting to your indexing function.
It's better to explicitly list all arguments with their type so that you can have a better documentation support.
Add parameters types.
Why is it unverified ?
Upgraded to langchain 0.1.0 (0.1.4 in lock file), added langchain-community ^0.0.16.
Done
Done
Done (changed to tock-llm-indexing-tools)

BaseEMSetting cannot be instantiated from concrete json dict, and get_em_factory discriminates based on class type, so this cannot be done.
Maybe a mixup between BaseEMSetting and EMSetting?

As designed (asked by Mohamed) : without the '-v' option, the script prints the indexation session id (this is not a log line).
Can you confirm?

By design: the method is proposed as an importable convenience that does the same, but the script is supposed to be used via its docopt-documented CLI. The goal was not to double the same comments (douvbling maintainance).
Can you confirm?

Duly noted, read the article.
Do you confirm I shall rewrite all logs in the 3 scripts? (perf is not a priority, and this can easily introduce bugs)
Done (use pandas to update metadata).
Done

By design: checks in main are meant to be fail-soon CLI args-checks (valid JSON inputed by script user), they are then passed along to the heavy-processing index_documents() method.
What do you think?
idem #287 (comment)
Done
I can't seem to remember: removed it.
Ok we will see in the futur
Hum ok but it can be splitted, I will post a comment about it in my review.
I don't see the change about it.
hum ok usually we don't like doing the same stuff several time ^^
Ok
Ok thanks :)

node.title: Clean up `col_to_pattern` logic
node.body:
- Remove redundancy, increase code sharing.
- Explicitly let `sep=None` handle `list` cell in multicategorical columns
- More type checking of canonicalized `col_to_pattern` to raise informative errors.

node.bodyText: In general LGTM, left some comments

It will be soon. My pr is going to change the mapping. 😆 It would be ready for review soon
I deliberately made so, since the input here is supposed to be canonicalized dictionary. By default, col_to_pattern should be an empty dictionary.
Good point. will modify.
Actually, interesting. We should make it None and replace with {} inside. Will do this way.

:obj:text_embedder that embeds texts into vectors
Updated. Since empty dictionary will be never accessed, leaving them as None inside the class seems fine as well. Again, thanks for the good catch!

node.title: Feat : Create checkbox component
node.body:
<!--

Title Naming Conventions:

- Start with a capitalized prefix followed by an imperative form of a verb, just like a commit message.
- Refer to the "Commit Convention" for the prefix:
  https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-convention.

Example:
- Fix: Resolve memory leak in data processing module
- Feat: Add two-factor authentication
- Refactor: Improve state management in React components
- Docs: Add Windows setup instructions

-->

## Overview

<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes introduced by this PR. -->
Create Checkbox component based on shadcn [Checkbox](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/checkbox)

## Changes

<!-- List the changes -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- Added `Checkbox.tsx` to `src/components/ui` directory.
- Added `CheckboxUsageExample.tsx`
- Added export of `Checkbox` in `src/components/ui/index.ts` 
- Added `icon_check.svg` to `assets/images/icons`
- Added color `white` to Icon component variant

## Review points

<!-- List the points you would like to be reviewed in detail and the points you are not confident about. -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- Since there weren't any size variation, I didn't add variants for checkbox, so checkbox rectangle is fixed to be 24px square, and check icon is fixed to be 14px. We can override it any time with `className` tho. **Should I make size variant already, considering the desktop design?**
   

## Screen Captures

<!-- Add screenshots or screen recordings of the changes -->
<!-- Necessary for UI changes -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->


https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/assets/99339182/31220b71-7c09-4270-8b37-13f8834e5fdb



## References

<!-- List all the URLs of the references (documents, articles, youtube videos, etc.) that you used to complete this task -->
<!-- If you have referred to responses from ChatGPT or other AIs, please include the links to the conversations if possible -->
<!-- Delete this section if not needed -->

- [shadcn Checkbox component](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/components/checkbox)


## Assignee Checklist:

<!-- You can tick the checkboxes if not applicable -->

- [ ] The naming convention of the PR title is correct (See the comment at the top of this template)
- [ ] The base branch is correct (See: [Types of Branches](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#types-of-branches))
- [ ] The branch name follows the [Branch Naming Conventions](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#branch-naming-conventions)
- [ ] The correct assignees and reviewers have been designated for this PR
- [ ] The coding style follows the [Coding Style Guide](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/STYLEGUIDE.md)
- [ ] All the related issues are associated with this PR
- [ ] All criteria in the associated issues are met (please tick the checkboxes)
- [ ] My changes do not generate new warnings or errors (especially in the console)

## Reviewer Checklist:

<!-- You can tick the checkboxes if not applicable -->

- [ ] Double-check the "Assignee Checklist"
- [ ] The code follows the generic best practices and our [Coding Style Guide](https://github.com/genesis-tech-tribe/nishiki-frontend/blob/develop/docs/STYLEGUIDE.md)
- [ ] The code is well-commented and easy to understand
- [ ] The UI changes accurately reflect the provided design

node.bodyText: There is no point from me to mention. Thanks!

@kanta1207
Thank you for your work! I left some comments. Please kindly take a look at them.
Also could you tick the checklist, please? So we will be able to double-check them.
For your question,

Should I make size variant already, considering the desktop design?

I don't think you should define variants for the size, until it becomes necessary.
This <div> should be the <Label> tag, so that the entire card can toggle the checkbox.
I recommend against defining styles not in the provided design. Disabled checkboxes typically have different styles, such as a grayish color.
Does the color primary-foregroud exist?

Does this peer have any effects?
https://tailwindcss.com/docs/hover-focus-and-other-states#styling-based-on-sibling-state

The current border width looks a bit too thin to me.
I played around and figured out border-[1.2px] and border-[1.5px] looked nicer.
In fact, the border width of the original svg image in Figma is around 1.2px.
1px:

1.2px (this is the closest value to the original design):

1.5px:

I personally prefer 1.5px, but if you stick to the Figma design, around 1.2px would be the best.

I thought we might be able to utilize it, but now I feel like we can remove it!!
It doesn't have any effect itself, it can have some effect when checkbox component is used with other sibling element. But anyway we can pass peerclass anytime to CheckboxRoot only when it's needed.
I removed it in the latest commit!

It was complete mistake of mine, sorry!
I removed it!

Do you think it's better to add some typical style for disabled state?
Since it's currently not designed in wire frame, I removed disabled:cursor-not-allowed in the latest commit!

Thank you for pointing out!! I was a bit blind about it, sorry 😓
I didn't have much preference between 1.2px and 1.5px , so I decided to follow the figma, 1.2px!
Thus I set it as 0.075rem since we're using rem in our code base

Thank you for updating!
In general, disabled checkboxes are usually styled in a design. However, since our current features do not require disabled checkboxes, I suppose there is no need to define a style for them for now. When adding a new style to our code, it would be the time to ask the designers to add a new design to Figma.

Using rem for such small values may not be effective... I have never seen that before.
I asked ChatGPT, and here is the conversation:
https://chat.openai.com/share/a85682c7-e98b-4ab9-9f84-a0a0edc9d88d
Could you research more about it, please?

Use px when you need fixed-size elements that won't change, such as for borders or shadows.
Your suggestion and also this article below make sense. I think I'm going to use px for this
https://www.shecodes.io/athena/28078-when-to-use-ems-rems-and-px-in-css#:~:text=Use%20px%20when%20you%20need,their%20browser's%20default%20font%20size.
Other references:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33997943/0-1-rem-border-width-renders-differently-on-chrome-and-safari
https://kheohyeewei.medium.com/in-short-when-to-use-px-em-and-rem-b2de94e1b829
I see that it still remains 👀
@kanta1207 I understand that you have made an update, but it's not what I intended. First, we should always avoid using the plain
Thank you for updating and providing additional information :)
You mean peer on line 28 remains? I suppose it's removed in this commit, and I couldn't find it in the current branch
Sorry, I overlooked it... I suppose keeping it is acceptable if it's intentional, but thanks for updating!
Addressed in this PR: #191

why was forceSingleLine deleted?
this is what @AdamRamberg  added as a fix in #447 I gues it got lost, due to the way this PR was created by overriding the changes from the previous PRs
My bad, I should've checked if any external changes took place while my repo stayed the same. Fixing it
We don't want to remove the compiler flag conditions here. I can revert it since I have write access to the PR :)
Oh thanks! Sorry, I didn't mean to remove it, don't know how I missed it or how it got removed :/

node.title: Add model for iCubGenova11
node.body:
The `iCubGenova11` is an iCub 2.7, so we generated the model accordingly.

It also fixes https://github.com/robotology/icub-models-generator/issues/255 to ensure that CI is green. I manually run the CI to push the generated files in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models/tree/addicubgenova11 for testing @martinaxgloria .
